data.title: The NBA congratulates Derek Fisher on his new position in New York
data.text:
A few days ago Derek Fisher was an active player. The veteran point guard, at 39 years old, was playing in the Conference Semifinals against the Spurs, but in just a few hours his course in the NBA has taken a 180-degree turn.

Fisher, a disciple of Phil Jackson, has agreed to take over the New York Knicks bench for the next 5 seasons at a cost of $25 million.

The player, who has hung up his boots to accept a demanding position in the Big Apple, has shown throughout his career that he has been a good teammate. Numerous former colleagues have congratulated him through social networks for his new job.

Kevin Durant: «Very happy for my brother @DerekFisher. I can speak for the entire State of Oklahoma when I say that you will be missed and that we love you. Good luck coach.

Magic Johnson: "New York Knicks fans around the world should be excited that Derek Fisher has been named Head Coach. The man who knows how to win!

Nazr Mohammed: «@DerekFisher gave me one of the most motivational speeches I have ever heard from a basketball player. A born and well-deserved leader.

Brian Cardinal: «Congratulations to my friend @DerekFisher on his new position. Can. Make it happen. "New York City."
